titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jules Kirsch Collection on Art Young TAM.787
titlestmt.author: Rachel Searcy

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-03 11:50:13 -0400.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.unittitle: Jules Kirsch Collection on Art Young
did.abstract: Jules P. Kirsch is a New York-based attorney. He was a member of the Lawyers' Constitutional Defense Committee in the 1960s, focusing on civil rights efforts. This collection consists of materials created and collected by Kirsch concerning cartoonist Art Young, including correspondence between Kirsch and photographer Berenice Abbot and a photographic print of Young.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of materials created and collected by Jules Kirsch concerning cartoonist Art Young, including correspondence between Kirsch and photographer Berenice Abbot and a photographic print of Young.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Jules P. Kirsch is a New York-based attorney. He was a member of the Lawyers' Constitutional Defense Committee in the 1960s, focusing on civil rights efforts.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Jules Kirsch in December 2018; the accession number associated with this gift is 2019.062.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Jules Kirsch Collection on Art Young; TAM 787; box number; folder number or item identifier; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning materials were rehoused in an archival box and folder, and described on the collection-level.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
